tutorial.label: Troubleshoot device connection issues.
tutorial.remoteLinkLabel: View the device setup instructions in a browser.
tutorial.description: This guide helps you troubleshoot issues connecting and running your app on a physical device.

stepElement.section: Verify that your operating system is able to see your deviceâ€”it may appear as a USB drive. If you're not sure, click the button below to scan for connected USB devices, and check whether your device appears in the list.
If your computer does not detect your device, disconnect and reconnect your device, or try using a different USB cable. If the issue persists, click Next below.
For ADB to recognize your device as a target for deploying debuggable APKs, you must first enable USB debugging in the on-device developer options.

Depending on the version of Android you're using, proceed as follows:
  • On Android 8.0 and higher, go to Settings > System > About phone and tap Build number seven times.
  • On Android 4.2 and higher, go to Settings > About phone and tap Build number seven times.
Return to the main Settings menu to find Developer options at the bottom. In the Developer options menu, scroll down and enable USB debugging.

step.label: Restart the ADB (Android Debug Bridge) server

stepElement.section: If you do not see your device, and you followed the previous steps, click the button below to stop and restart the local ADB server. This also causes ADB to search for new devices.
If your device appears below after restarting the ADB server, try deploying your app to the device. Otherwise, click Next below to submit a bug report.
